titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Betty Feves Scrapbook 1920s-1937
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Mark O'English

publicationstmt.publisher: Washington State University Libraries Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Suzanne James-Bacon. 2021
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid written in English. English.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS 2nd Edition ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: Scrapbook of sculptor Betty Feves, containing photographs and drawings from her LaCrosse High School and Washington State College days. Includes images of Clyfford Still and Alexander Archipenko.

bioghist.p: Betty Jean Whiteman (1918-1985) spent her childhood in the Milton-Freewater, Walla Walla, and La Crosse areas, and the attended Washington State College from 1935 to 1939, graduating with a B.A. in Fine Arts. While at WSC, she studied under Clyfford Still. She received her M.A. from Columbia University, and worked in the New York City area during World War II; after marrying Louis Feves to become Betty Feves she returned to the northwest and spent the remainder of her life in Pendleton, OR. She had a career as a noted artist, primarily working in clay.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a single scrapbook, focused primarily on her undergraduate years at Washington State College, but also including images from her high school and childhood years. Not counting blank pages, there are 37 pages of photographs and text, or 231 individual images. One page includes photographs of art done during a summer of coursework at the University of Washington, studying under Alexander Archipenko.
In addition to photographs, the collection contains numerous caricatures drawn by Feves of her college friends and teachers.
Handwritten labels and art in white were created by Betty; labels in other colors were primarily added by her husband Lou.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: Alan Feves of Pendleton, OR initially loaned this scrapbook to the WSU Museum of Fine Art in spring of 2020, and subsequently donated it to the Washington State University Libraries in March of 2021.

processinfo.p: Mark O’English processed this collection in May of 2021.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
